prompt: Rank in order from most to least important

options.description: Leadership is taking initiative and following the path less traveled. “A great leader takes people where they don’t necessarily want to go, but ought to be.” —Rosalynn Carter (GoodReads.com). Leadership defines greatness simply by definition
Defining a problem; determining the cause of the problem; identifying, prioritizing, and selecting alternatives for a solution; and implementing a solution.

A team player is someone who actively contributes to their group in order to complete tasks, meet goals or manage projects. Team players actively listen to their coworkers, respect ideas and aim to improve the product or process at hand. -Indeed.com
Willing to put in extra work on their own to learn new and useful skills to support the team. Continuous improvement ensures an engineer's skillset will always stay relevant.

prompt: Select the option that is most important to you

options.description: Ensures an applicant has a thorough understanding of the theoretical knowledge necessary to apply computer science principles to build high quality software.
Empowers an applicant by giving them the necessary time to grow and perfect their skills, growing their confidence and capabilities.

Allows an applicant familiarize themselves with the advantages and disadvantages of a varienty of approaches to a problem. This way they can accurately choose the tools and techniques best suited to each situation.
